column4: hi , using 10.10 I had install an application , when I start it prompt for password and i displaying some file will be modified .I am not sure whether it's safe to let it modified ? any help guys ? Here's the pastebin http://pastebin.com/JvkJ0Y3u  Thank you :)
more like the application might require root access because of the files it is trying to modify may belong to root rather than the fact that you can run the app as user I think
then again, I'd check to see of /tmp/fuse belongs to root or not. I certainly do not have that directory so I cannot confirm it
: check on temp/fuse and it's empty on the fuse folder
you meant /tmp, but what about the permissions on /tmp/fuse?
:  without typing the password the application still launch
:  /tmp/fuse folder is empty
I'm not saying if its empty or not, or does the directory exist? If it does, check to see who owns that directory or just tell me that there's no such directory :)
If the directory /tmp/fuse doesn't exist in the first place you would have gotten this message: ls: cannot access /tmp/fuse: No such file or directory
:  there a directory exist , drwxr-xr-x
yes so that directory exist, now see who owns that directory, it will tell you in the next two columns, first column from that output would be the UID and then it would be followed by GID
:  there is also an application .domain at the /tmp/ srwxr-xr-x
ok, pastebin (not paste) the output of the command: ls -al /tmp
:  http://pastebin.com/0WYTgV6g

seems like /tmp/fuse is owned by you, yet I don't see why the application would say that it would be modifying critical parts of the system.. Again I'm still presuming the parent directory belongs to root, hence that warning. I'm presuming it should be safe to ignore the warning

:  oh , thanks , feeling weird it required a password prompt when running the application . Just wanted to make sure whether it's safe .Seems like it's safe , even I didn't input the password , the application still launch and run .

yeah the program will still run, the program will simply be denied access to modifying those files because /tmp is owned by root basically even though /tmp/fuse is owned by you. Though I don't know what sort of restrictions would that impose, at worse it may cause stale mounts
:  tested again , application still launch but some function not working . hm.. .will inspect it again
I'm sure the application requires root access in that case
: anyhow it's working after entering the password . Thanks for the support and  help :D
nw
